info.name: Proficiencies and Properties
info.description: The new proficiencies and properties from Valda's Spire of Secrets.
info.author: Valda's Spire of Secrets

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Cestus)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_BLUDGEONING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LIGHT, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FIST

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Claw Gauntlet)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_SLASHING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LIGHT, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FIST

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Fishhook)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_PIERCING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_VERSATILE

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Hook Hand)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FINESSE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_PIERCING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LIGHT, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_HOOK_HAND

description.p: This is a one-handed weapon, usable only if you are missing a hand or have a special cuff designed to fit over your hand. Any humanoid that is missing a hand and regularly wears a hook has proficiency with this weapon.

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Kama)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FINESSE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_SLASHING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LIGHT

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Machete)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_SLASHING, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_MACHETE

description.p: This weapon deals double damage to plants and creatures of the plant type.

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Pickaxe)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_PIERCING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_TWOHANDED

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Punching Dagger)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_PIERCING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LIGHT, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FIST

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Sai)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_PIERCING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LIGHT, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FINESSE

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Scorpion on a Stick)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_POISON

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Shovel)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_SLASHING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_TWOHANDED

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Tonfa)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_BLUDGEONING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LIGHT

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Bolas)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Ranged, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_RANGED, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_BOLAS, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_THROWN

description.p: A creature hit by a bolas falls prone until it is freed. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the bolas (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the bolas. You can only throw one bolas on your turn.

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Shuriken)
element.supports: Weapon, Simple, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_SIMPLE_RANGED, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_SLASHING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_THROWN, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FINESSE

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Bayonet)
element.supports: Weapon, Martial, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_MARTIAL_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FINESSE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_PIERCING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_LIGHT, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_BAYONET

description.p: As an action, a bayonet can be mounted to any two-handed ranged weapon or removed from it. While mounted, you can use the bayonet to make a two-handed melee weapon attack, which deals 1d8 piercing damage on a hit.

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Catchpole)
element.supports: Weapon, Martial, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_MARTIAL_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_PIERCING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_REACH, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_TWOHANDED, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_CATCHPOLE

description.p: This weapon is used to immobilize creatures at a distance. When you hit a creature of Large size or smaller with this weapon, you can attempt to grapple the creature instead of dealing damage. This grapple check uses your attack roll instead of a Strength (Athletics) check.

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Cutlass)
element.supports: Weapon, Martial, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_MARTIAL_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_SLASHING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FINESSE

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Estoc)
element.supports: Weapon, Martial, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_MARTIAL_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_PIERCING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_VERSATILE

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Harpoon)
element.supports: Weapon, Martial, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_MARTIAL_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_PIERCING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_THROWN, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_HARPOON

description.p: You can use an action to tie a rope to the end of a harpoon before it is thrown. If a rope-tied harpoon hits a target, it becomes embedded in the target, and you can use an action on subsequent turns to hold fast to the rope and make an opposed Strength (Athletics) check against the target to pull it up to 10 feet closer to you. Additionally, when the target moves, you can use your reaction to make an opposed Strength (Athletics) check against it, preventing its movement on a success. If you use your action to do anything else, you lose your grip on the rope. If the target has hands, it can remove the harpoon as an action.

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Katana)
element.supports: Weapon, Martial, Melee, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_CATEGORY_MARTIAL_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_SLASHING, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FINESSE, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_VERSATILE

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Zweihander)
element.supports: Weapon, Exotic, Melee, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_CATEGORY_EXOTIC_MELEE, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_PIERCING, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SUPERHEAVY, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_HEAVY, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_TWOHANDED, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_GROUP_SWORDS

element.name: Weapon Proficiency (Bomb)
element.supports: Weapon, Martial, Ranged, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_CATEGORY_EXOTIC_RANGED, ID_INTERNAL_DAMAGE_TYPE_FIRE, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_FINESSE, ID_MHP_VSOS_WEAPON_PROPERTY_SPECIAL_BOMB, ID_INTERNAL_WEAPON_PROPERTY_THROWN

description.p: When a bomb hits a target, it explodes in a 5-foot radius and is destroyed. The bomb can be thrown at an unoccupied space within its range. Each creature other than the target within the blast radius must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking half the damage rolled on a failed save or no damage on a successful one.
Additionally, as a bonus action, you can empty some of the bomb's explosive material to permanently remove the blast radius from this bomb, dealing damage only to the bomb's target.

description.p: Of all the armor categories, heavy armor offers the best protection. These suits of armor cover the entire body and are designed to stop a wide range of attacks. Only proficient w arriors can manage their weight and bulk.
Heavy armor doesn't let you add your Dexterity modifier to your Armor Class, but it also doesn't penalize you if your Dexterity modifier is negative.

element.name: Armor Proficiency (Brigandine)
element.supports: Exotic Armor, ID_MHP_VSOS_ARMOR_GROUP_EXOTIC

description.p: When you make an attack with this weapon on your turn, you can choose to make two attacks instead. These attacks are always made with disadvantage, regardless of circumstance. These attacks use twice the normal amount of ammunition.
While stowed, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to conceal this weapon.

This weapon has two damage-dealing ends. When you use the Attack action and make an attack with this weapon, you can use your bonus action to make an additional attack with it; you do not add your ability modifier to the damage roll of this bonus attack.

If this weapon is ever submerged in water or doused with a significant quantity of water, it jams. A jammed firearm can't be used to make an attack until a creature uses its action to clear the weapon malfunction.
This weapon requires exceptional skill to use. You must have a Dexterity score of 16 or higher to wield an elegant weapon.

When this weapon's projectile hits a target, it explodes in a 15-foot diameter sphere. The projectile can target an unoccupied space within its range. Each creature other than the target within the blast radius (for a Medium or smaller target, each creature within 5 feet of it) must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking half the damage rolled on a failed save or no damage on a successful one.
Attacks made with this weapon are treated as unarmed strikes.
This weapon can be used with one or two hands. If used in two hands, its normal range increases by 50 feet and its long range increases by 200 feet

This weapon gains a heat point whenever an attack is made with it, and loses one heat point whenever you begin your turn. If the weapon gains 3 heat points, it overheats and loses all heat points. An overheated weapon can't be used to make an attack again until the end of your next turn.

You can only make an attack with this weapon when you take the Attack action, and only as the first attack you make on your turn. Once you make an attack with this weapon, you can't attack again until the start of your next turn. If you would be able to attack more than once when you take the Attack action on your turn, you deal an extra two dice of damage for each attack you forgo when using this weapon.
When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll with this weapon, it jams. A jammed weapon can't be used to make an attack until a creature uses its action to clear the weapon malfunction.

This weapon is normally used while attached to a tripod, vehicle, or other bracing mount. You can mount or unmount this weapon as an action. While it is mounted, it can't be moved. It can only be used to make an attack while unmounted if held by a Medium or larger creature with a Strength score of at least 15.
While wielding this weapon and not wielding a shield, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC against melee attacks.
Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with this weapon if you have advantage on the attack roll.

This weapon can be used to make a number of attacks before it must be reloaded. If you are proficient with the weapon, reloading it takes a bonus action; otherwise, reloading it takes an action. Some weapons require an action or longer to reload, even if you have proficiency, which is specified in the Reload property. If reloading a weapon requires longer than one action, the weapon can't be used to make attacks until reloading is finished.
After being thrown, this weapon returns to your hand at the end of your turn.
This weapon has a small propulsive engine attached to it or its projectiles. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can deal an extra 1d4 damage to the target.
If you make an attack against a target that is within half this weapon's normal range, you deal the damage value listed in parentheses instead of the weapon's normal damage dice.
This weapon has disadvantage on attack rolls made against targets within 20 feet.
This weapon is unusually large for its type. You must have a Strength score of 16 or higher to wield a superheavy weapon.
This weapon has two forms. You can swap between which weapon is being used at any time, even between attacks.
When making a ranged weapon attack with a tension weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
You can make a shove attempt against any creature within this weapon's reach. Furthermore, you have advantage on ability checks you make to shove a creature using this weapon.

Once on each of your turns when you make an attack with this weapon, you can make another attack with it against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of the weapon.

This weapon can be used to make 1 attack before it must be reloaded. It require 2 actions to reload, even if you have proficiency, which is specified in the Reload property. If reloading a weapon requires longer than one action, the weapon can't be used to make attacks until reloading is finished.
This weapon can be used to make a number of attacks before it must be reloaded. If you are proficient with the weapon, reloading it takes a bonus action; otherwise, reloading it takes an action.
This weapon can be used to make a number of attacks before it must be reloaded. If you are proficient with the weapon, reloading it takes a bonus action; otherwise, reloading it takes an action.
This weapon can be used to make a number of attacks before it must be reloaded. If you are proficient with the weapon, reloading it takes a bonus action; otherwise, reloading it takes an action.

This weapon can be used to make 10 attacks before it must be reloaded. It require 2 actions to reload, even if you have proficiency, which is specified in the Reload property. If reloading a weapon requires longer than one action, the weapon can't be used to make attacks until reloading is finished.
This weapon can be used to make a number of attacks before it must be reloaded. If you are proficient with the weapon, reloading it takes a bonus action; otherwise, reloading it takes an action.
This weapon can be used to make a number of attacks before it must be reloaded. If you are proficient with the weapon, reloading it takes a bonus action; otherwise, reloading it takes an action.
This weapon can be used to make a number of attacks before it must be reloaded. If you are proficient with the weapon, reloading it takes a bonus action; otherwise, reloading it takes an action.
